result.execSummary:
The defendant Cal E Lock Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Probation allowed to be transfer to Milwaukee County.

miscConds.notes: Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.

No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.

Obtain a valid driver's license.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

supervisions.notes:
Huber with standard release conditions.  Sentence Credit for 1 day granted if revoked.
Consecutive to: court 2.

miscConds.notes: Bail applied to costs.  Paid in full.  Balance to be refunded to poster.

timeConds.notes: Non-working hours with standard release conditions -STAYED- to be used at Agent's discretion.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cal E Lock Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.

Defendant Cal E Lock in court with Attorney J Anthony Rosario.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Katrina Seipel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing hearing.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Rosario makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #2:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

30 DAYS HUBER 

TERM OF PROBATION:  18 MONTHS    **transfer allowed to Milwaukee County**

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____Obtain a valid driver's license

COSTS:  WAIVED


COUNT #3:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

120 DAYS HUBER  ( 1 DAY CREDIT)          **CONSECUTIVE** 

TERM OF PROBATION:  18 MONTHS    **transfer allowed to Milwaukee County**

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____Obtain a valid driver's license

COSTS:  $243.00 (to be paid out of cash bail posted ($250.00) and remainder to be returned to poster) 

CONDITION TIME:  30 Days,  Non-working hours with standard release conditions  - STAYED - to be used at agent's discretion
Sentencing hearing on June 26, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Cal E Lock in court with attorney J Anthony Rosario.  Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Counts 2 and 3.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Counts 1 and 4 dismissed and read in.  Case 15CT298 dismissed and read in to this matter.  Defense requests adjourned sentencing date.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 26, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Cal E Lock in court with attorney J Anthony Rosario.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Becky Van Dam, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is working on obtaining valid license.  Hearing scheduled for May 22, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

Defendant Cal E Lock in court, in custody, with attorney Eryn M Menden.   Timothy F. Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Defendant allowed a free phone call to obtain bail.  Hearing scheduled for April 9, 2015 at 09:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Cal E Lock Jr
Current: 3226 N. 36th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53216   (Effective: 03-11-2015)
Prior: 3278 N 3rd St, Milwaukee, WI 53212
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
